title: Figma Buzz Unveils Three New Features to Accelerate Brand Asset Creation and Consistency

paragraphs.content: Figma Buzz, a beta tool for generating on-brand marketing assets, launched three new features on December 11, 2025: configurable templates linked to design systems, plugins for integrations like digital asset management and animation, and in-app video trimming. These updates enable marketers and designers to produce consistent social media graphics, posters, and event materials faster without external tools. The features connect directly to Figma's design systems, ensuring brand alignment across workflows.

paragraphs.content: Configurable templates use component properties such as variants and booleans, allowing easy swaps without managing multiple static versions. Plugins expand Buzz's capabilities by integrating animation and translation tools directly on the canvas. Video trimming provides precise control for syncing clips in collages and ads, eliminating tool-switching.

sections.title: Configurable Templates Harness Design Systems for Flexible Branding

paragraphs.content: Templates in Figma Buzz now leverage component properties from design systems, enabling marketers to browse and switch layouts, colors, or elements like logos seamlessly. Publishing occurs after building in Figma Design and copying to Buzz, where sets convert automatically while preserving connections to libraries. Variable modes support configurations like color themes or localized content within a single template.

paragraphs.content: Nested instances in templates receive updates by pulling library changes and re-publishing, maintaining scalability for teams. Professional plans limit publications to five templates, while Organization and Enterprise allow unlimited. Clear property naming ensures intuitive dropdowns for non-designers configuring assets.

sections.title: Plugins and Video Tools Enhance In-App Production Efficiency

paragraphs.content: Plugins bring digital asset management, animation, and translation into Buzz, with teams able to publish internal plugins via Figma Community for custom workflows. Animation allows motion design on headlines or visuals without leaving the canvas. Video trimming enables direct in-app edits for fitting clips in time-constrained assets like ads.

Future expansions tie into Figma's 2025 ecosystem, including AI image generation for refined outputs. Analysts view this as strengthening enterprise governance alongside speed for marketing teams.
